Question: How many peaches are in the baskets altogether?

Body: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 9 cups of sugar 14 cups of flour and 40 cups of salt. She already put in 4 cups of flour.
Question: How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?

Body: There were 106 dollars in Olivia's wallet. After she visited a supermarket and a showroom there were 26 dollars left. If she spent 49 dollars at the showroom
Question: How much did she spend at the supermarket?

Body: Rachel picked 6 ripe apples from her tree. Now the tree has 2 ripe apples and 4 unripe apples.
Question: How many apples did the tree have to begin with?

Body: Ed had 24 more marbles than Doug. Doug lost 27 of his marbles at the playground while Ed found 9 more marbles.
Question: How many more marbles did Ed have than Doug then?

Body: Rachel had to complete 2 pages of math homework, 3 pages of reading homework and 10 more pages of biology homework.
Question: How many pages did she have to complete in all?

Body: Baker made 110 cakes. He sold 75 of them. Then he made 76 more cakes.
Question: How many cakes would baker still have?

Body: Ed had 6 more marbles than Doug. Doug lost 7 of his marbles at the playground. If Ed had 22 marbles
Question: How many marbles does Doug have now?

Body: A waiter had 3 customers. After some left he still had 4 customers.
Question: How many more customers stayed behind than those that left?

Body: Paul got a box of some crayons for his birthday. During the school year he gave 563 crayons to his friends while he lost 558 crayons. If he only had 332 crayons left
Question: How many crayons did he get for his birthday?

Body: Jerry had 5 action figures and 9 books on a shelf in his room. Later he added 7 more action figures to the shelf.
Question: How many more action figures than books were on his shelf?

Body: Kelly has 80 nintendo games. She found 31 more nintendo games.
Question: How many does she need to give away so that she will have 6 games left?

Body: For the walls of the house he would use 11 nails in all to secure large planks of wood. If each plank needs 3 pieces of nails to be secured and an additional 8 nails were used.
Question: How many planks does John need for the house wall?

Body: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. If 324 students suggested adding mashed potatoes 374 suggested adding bacon to the menu and 128 suggested adding tomatoes
Question: How many students participated in the suggestion of new food items?

Body: 6 birds and 3 storks were sitting on the fence. 2 more storks came to join them.
Question: How many more birds than storks are sitting on the fence?

Body: A grocery store had 57 bottles of regular soda, 26 bottles of diet soda and 27 bottles of lite soda.
Question: How many bottles did they have total?

Body: Edward spent $ 9. Then he spent $ 8 more. Now he has $ 17.
Question: How much did Edward have before he spent his money?

Body: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. There are 85 bird families living near the mountain. If 23 bird families flew away to africa and 37 bird families flew away to asia
Question: How many bird families were left near the mountain?

Body: At the arcade Dave had won 18 tickets. If he used 5 to buy some toys and 11 more to buy some clothes
Question: How many tickets did Dave have left?

Body: Allan brought 2 balloons and Jake brought 6 balloons to the park. Allan then bought 3 more balloons at the park.
Question: How many more balloons did Jake have than Allan in the park?

Question: How many sacks of oranges will they have after 26 days of harvest?

Question: How many more trees survived the typhoon than those that died?

Body: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Marco's strawberries weighed 30 pounds. If together their strawberries weighed 47 pounds.
Question: How much more did his strawberries weigh than his dad's?

Body: Debby bought 264 water bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 15 bottles a day for 11 days.
Question: How many bottles does she have left?

Body: Bryan took a look at his books and magazines. If he has 23 books and 61 magazines in each of his 29 bookshelves
Question: How many books and magazines does he have in total?

Body: A farmer had 105 green tomatoes and 71 red tomatoes in his garden. If he picked 137 tomatoes
Question: How many tomatoes are left?

Body: Lewis earns $ 21 every week during the 216 weeks of harvest. If he has to pay $ 702 tax
Question: How much money will have at the end of the harvest season?

Body: Nell collects baseball cards. She had 566 cards while Jeff had 234 cards. She gave some of her cards to Jeff and now has 535 cards left.
Question: How many cards does Jeff have now?

Question: How much more did his dad's strawberries weigh than his?

Body: Paco had 36 cookies. He gave 14 cookies to his friend and ate 10 cookies.
Question: How many cookies did Paco have left?

Body: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. If they have 5 sets of tables and each set has 10 chairs
Question: How many more chairs than tables do they have?

Body: A farmer had 177 tomatoes and 12 potatoes in his garden. If he picked 53 tomatoes
Question: How many tomatoes and potatoes does he have left?

Body: Robin has 28 packages of gum and 14 packages of candy. There are 6 pieces in each package.
Question: How many pieces does Robin have?

Body: Haley grew 9 trees in her backyard. After a typhoon 4 died. Then she grew 5 more trees.
Question: How many trees does she have left?

Body: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 9 cups of flour and 6 cups of sugar. She already put in 4 cups of sugar.
Question: How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?

Body: Jesse's room is 2 feet long and 12 feet wide. If each tile is of size 4 square feet
Question: How many tiles does she need to cover the whole floor?

Body: An industrial machine can make 6 shirts a minute. It worked for 12 minutes yesterday and for 14 shirts today.
Question: How many shirts did machine make altogether?

Body: In a school there are 868 girls and the rest are boys. If there are 281 more girls than boys
Question: How many pupils are there in that school?

Question: How many push-ups did Zachary and David do altogether?

Question: How many more bird families stayed behind than those that flew away for the winter?

Question: How many buses are needed to take the trip?

Question: How much more carpet does she need to cover the whole floor?

Question: How many chairs are left unoccupied?

Question: How many visited the Buckingham palace within the past 89 days?

Question: How many books did he sell?

Question: How many more storks than birds are sitting on the fence?

Question: How many apps did he delete?

Question: How far did the mouse jump?

Question: How many green peaches are in each basket?

Question: How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?

Question: How many kids did she play with altogether?

Question: How big is each group?

Question: How many pieces of junk mail should he give in total?

Question: How many pieces of candy does he still have left?

Question: How many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?

Body: In a school there are 315 girls and 309 boys. There are also 772 teachers
Question: How many people are there in that school?

Question: How much money does he earn during harvest season?

Question: How many points did she score in 79 games?

Question: How deep was the water?
